_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Mars Chocolate utilizes anhydrous ammonia as a refrigerant for cooling of air handler units and chilling for process equipment. The facility has an ammonia storage capacity of approximately 41,353 pounds.  Ammonia is stored in pressure vessels, piping and miscellaneous equipment. The maximum amount of ammonia stored in any one vessel is approximately 8,662 pounds.



The Mars facility meets Program 3 eligibility requirements of the RMP Rule because the facility is subject to the OSHA PSM standard.  



The prevention program implemented at the Mars facility was developed to meet OSHA PSM 29 CFR 1910.119 requirements.  In accordance with 40 CFR 68.175 the following is a summary of the prevention program in place at the Mars facility.



Most recent process hazard analysis:  Completed April 2013

Operating procedures: Last reviewed April 2013

Training programs: Last reviewed April 2013

Maintenance procedures: Last reviewed April 2013

Management of change procedures: Last reviewed April 2013

Compliance audit:  To be conducted April 2016

Employee participation plans:  Last reviewed April 2013

Hot work permit procedures:  Last reviewed April 2013

Contractor safety procedures:  Last reviewed April 2013

Contractor safety performance:  Last evaluated April 2013



The Mars facility has an emergency response program in place which outlines the actions to be taken for a facility evacuation, ammonia release, or natural disaster.  A training schedule has also been established to train employees on the emergency response program.  The Topeka Fire Department, Police Department and the Shawnee County Emergency Management have been designated as the responding agencies.  Evacuation procedures are in place for an ammonia release with meeting locations outlined.  



No accidental releases of ammonia, which resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage has occurred on site, or known deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environ
mental damage, have occurred offsite from the Mars facility.
